title: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations               Permits & Reservations       Reservations - Pennsylvania    Milford Beach Group Picnic Area  Nine picnic tables in open area with some trees For reservations and more information call (570) 426-2440  Dingmans Campground  133 wooded and river's edge campsites; some electric and water hookups Group campsites available for 20 to 40 people Visit the Dingmans Campground website for current rates For reservations and more information call (877) 828-1551 or (570) 828-1551 Reservations are not required  Valley View Group Campground  Primitive group campsites in wooded area next to the river Drinking water available Minimum of five people to reserve site Visit the Dingmans Campground website for current rates For reservations and more information call (877) 828-1551 or (570) 828-1551 Reservations are required  Alosa River Campsites  6 primitive boater campsites with portable toilet and fire ring For more information about Alosa River Campsites webpage Reservations can be made at www.recreation.gov (search for "Alosa") Reservations are required   Reservations - New Jersey    Rivers Bend Group Campground  Primitive group campsites in open area with some trees next to the river Drinking water available Minimum of five people to reserve site For reservations and more information call (570) 426-2452 Reservations are required  Mohican Outdoor Center  Large/small group cabins and individual/group campsites in a wooded setting Adjacent to the Appalachian National Scenic Trail Drinking water available Visit the Mohican Outdoor Center website for current rates For reservations and more information call (603) 466-2727   Â      Wedding at Millbrook Village NPS Photo  Permits Certain types of activities require a special use permit. These include many types of organized gatherings, distribution of printed material and other public expressions of opinion, and other activities that are controlled or prohibited. Some common activities that require a permit include:    Commercial Film & Photography  Weddings  Baptisms  First Amendment Activities  Competitive Events   For more information please call (570) 426-2440 or email the park's special use coordinator.
